title: Fix lobby so unfiltered chatroom list loads automatically on first page load

requirements.text: Ensure the Lobby page always triggers the initial unfiltered chatroom fetch (React Query key ['chatrooms']) automatically on first page load once the backend actor becomes available, without requiring the user to click/tap a category filter.
acceptanceCriteria: On a cold load of the live site Lobby, chatrooms render automatically (when they exist) without the user interacting with category badges.
The unfiltered query for ['chatrooms'] executes after actor initialization, even if prior cached data for chatrooms is empty/stale.
Clicking category filters still works and does not become the only way to populate the lobby list.

requirements.text: Prevent React Query from serving stale/incorrect empty results caused by empty/whitespace search/category variants by ensuring that empty search/category states resolve to the canonical ['chatrooms'] cache key and that any legacy empty-filter cache entries are removed/ignored before rendering the lobby list.

quotes: On the live site, it only shows the rooms if I click or tap on a category tag to filter them. Why is that?

acceptanceCriteria: No queries remain cached under keys shaped like ['chatrooms','search',''] or ['chatrooms','category',''] (including whitespace-only equivalents) after the actor becomes ready.
When searchTerm and selectedCategory are empty/whitespace, the Lobby displays data from the canonical ['chatrooms'] query and not from any variant key.
After clearing filters, the Lobby returns to showing the unfiltered list without requiring a manual refresh.

requirements.text: Harden Lobby loading/error rendering so the page cannot get stuck showing the loading spinner indefinitely; when fetching fails, the user must see a clear error state with a working Retry action that triggers the correct refetch for the currently active (unfiltered/search/category) query.

quotes: On the live site, it only shows the rooms if I click or tap on a category tag to filter them. Why is that?

acceptanceCriteria: If the initial fetch fails, the Lobby shows an error state (not an infinite spinner) and the Retry button successfully re-attempts the appropriate fetch.
If cached chatrooms exist and a background refresh fails, the Lobby continues to show the cached list and displays a non-blocking refresh error message.
Loading UI only appears when a fetch is actually in-flight and there is no data to display yet (i.e., no permanent 'Loading chats...' state).

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/immutablePaths (including frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts and frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x)).
Keep all changes within the existing React + TypeScript + React Query architecture.
Do not introduce new backend canisters or external services.
nonGoals: No backend/Motoko behavior changes to chatroom retrieval are required for this fix.
No new product features (e.g., new filters, sorting modes, or auth changes) beyond ensuring initial lobby load works reliably.
